sections.title: Essential Commands
sections.content:
These are the commands you'll use 90% of the time:

CommandWhat It Does
rnstatusCheck if Reticulum is running, see interface status
rnpath <hash>Find a destination, check if reachable
rnsdRun Reticulum daemon in foreground
nomadnetStart NomadNet client
rnodeconf --infoCheck RNode status

sections.title: rnstatus - Check Status
sections.content:
First command to run when debugging. Shows all interfaces and their state.

# Basic status
rnstatus

# Verbose with traffic stats
rnstatus -v

# Show all known paths
rnstatus -p

What to Look For

  • Interface status: Should say "Up"
  • Peers: Should be > 0 if connected to testnet
  • Transport: Enabled/Disabled based on config

Example Output

Reticulum Network Stack
  Status    : Running
  Transport : Disabled

Interfaces
  TCPClientInterface [RNS Testnet]
    Status  : Up
    Peers   : 127
    Bitrate : 10.00 Mbps

sections.title: rnpath - Find Destinations
sections.content:
Check if you can reach a destination.

# Look up destination
rnpath 2eabad04f9145d32a6a3eda285d66c39

# Force path request (if not in cache)
rnpath -r 2eabad04f9145d32a6a3eda285d66c39

Success Output

Path found, destination is 2 hops away

Failure Output

No path to destination

If no path: destination is offline, not announcing, or you're not connected to any shared network.

sections.title: rnsd - Daemon
sections.content:
Keeps Reticulum running in the background. Required for other programs to use the network.

# Run in foreground (for debugging)
rnsd

# Run as daemon
rnsd -d

# Verbose output
rnsd -v

Systemd Service

# /etc/systemd/system/rnsd.service
[Unit]
Description=Reticulum Daemon
After=network.target

[Service]
Type=simple
User=user
ExecStart=/home/user/.local/bin/rnsd
Restart=always
Environment=PATH=/home/user/.local/bin:/usr/bin

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
sudo systemctl enable rnsd
sudo systemctl start rnsd

sections.title: rncp - File Transfer
sections.content:
Transfer files over Reticulum. Better than LXMF for large files.

Receive Mode

# Listen for incoming files
rncp -l

# Receive to specific directory
rncp -l -d /path/to/downloads

Send Mode

# Send file to destination
rncp -s <destination-hash> /path/to/file

Example

# On receiver
$ rncp -l
Listening for files...

# On sender
$ rncp -s 2eabad04... document.pdf
Transfer complete (1.2 MB)

sections.title: rnodeconf - RNode Management
sections.content:
Configure and flash RNode hardware.

Check Device Info

rnodeconf /dev/ttyUSB0 --info

Auto-Install Firmware

rnodeconf --autoinstall

Manual Configuration

# Set frequency
rnodeconf /dev/ttyUSB0 --freq 915000000

# Set TX power
rnodeconf /dev/ttyUSB0 --txpower 17

# Set spreading factor
rnodeconf /dev/ttyUSB0 --sf 8

Troubleshooting

  • Hold BOOT button while connecting USB
  • Verify it's a data cable, not charge-only
  • Check permissions: sudo usermod -aG dialout $USER

sections.title: rnid - Identity Management
sections.content:
Manage Reticulum identities (keypairs).

# Show identity info
rnid -i /path/to/identity

# Generate new identity
rnid -g /path/to/new-identity

# Export public key
rnid -e /path/to/identity

Identity Location

Default identity: ~/.reticulum/identity

This is your cryptographic identity. Back it up. If you lose it, you lose your address and can't decrypt messages sent to it.

sections.title: rnprobe - Test Connectivity
sections.content:
Probe a destination to check reachability and measure latency.

# Single probe
rnprobe <destination-hash>

# Continuous probing
rnprobe -c <destination-hash>

Example

$ rnprobe 2eabad04f9145d32a6a3eda285d66c39
Response received in 1.234 seconds

Useful for verifying connectivity before sending important messages.

sections.title: Configuration File
sections.content:
Main config: ~/.reticulum/config

Structure

[reticulum]
  enable_transport = no
  share_instance = yes

[logging]
  loglevel = 4

[interfaces]
  [[Interface Name]]
    type = InterfaceType
    enabled = yes
    # type-specific options

Log Levels

LevelShows
0Critical only
4Info (default)
6Debug
7Extreme debug (noisy)

For debugging, set loglevel = 6 and run rnsd -v in foreground.
